abstract.text: Indicates the highest vertical extent for your onscreen content, for use with Auto Layout constraints.

inlineContent.text: Use the
property of
instead.

inlineContent.text: The

property comes into play when a view controller is frontmost onscreen. It indicates the highest vertical extent for content that you don’t want to appear behind a translucent or transparent UIKit bar (such as a status or navigation bar). This property implements the
protocol and you can employ it as a constraint item when using the
class.
The value of this property is, specifically, the value of the

property of the object returned when you query this property. This value is constrained by either the view controller or by its enclosing container view controller (such as a navigation or tab bar controller), as follows:
A view controller
not within
a container view controller constrains this property to indicate the bottom of the status bar, if visible, or else to indicate the top edge of the view controller’s view.
A view controller
within
a container view controller does not set this property’s value. Instead, the container view controller constrains the value to indicate:
The bottom of the navigation bar, if a navigation bar is visible
The bottom of the status bar, if only a status bar is visible
The top edge of the view controller’s view, if neither a status bar nor navigation bar is visible

If a container navigation controller’s navigation bar is visible and opaque, the navigation controller lays out the frontmost view controller’s view so its top edge abuts the bottom of the navigation bar. In this case, the value of this property is
Query this property within your implementation of the
method.

When laying out a storyboard scene, the Top Layout Guide object is available in the Interface Builder outline view as a child of the View Controller object. Adding a top layout guide using Interface Builder provides backward compatibility to iOS 6.

As an example of how to programmatically use this property with Auto Layout, say you want to position a control such that its top edge is 20 points below the top layout guide. This scenario applies to any of the scenarios listed above. Use code similar to the following:

code: [self.view layoutSubviews]; // You must call this method here or the system raises an exception

inlineContent.text: If you define Auto Layout constraints in a storyboard file as well as programmatically, it is your responsibility to ensure the constraints do not conflict. If they do conflict, the system may throw a runtime exception.

To use a top layout guide without using constraints, obtain the guide’s position relative to the top bound of the containing view. In the case of using a view controller subclass, obtain the numbers you need as follows:
In the case of using a view subclass, obtain the numbers you need as follows:

code: [super layoutSubviews]; // You must call super here or the system raises an exception

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The relationship between two user interface objects that must be satisfied by the constraint-based layout system.
A set of methods that provide layout support and access to layout anchors.
Provides the length, in points, of the portion of a view controller’s view that is overlaid by translucent or transparent UIKit bars.
An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
The layout guide representing the portion of your view that is unobscured by bars and other content.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view controller should automatically adjust its scroll view insets.
Indicates the lowest vertical extent for your onscreen content, for use with Auto Layout constraints.
The size of the view controller’s view while displayed in a popover.
Convenience property that provides the current orientation of the interface, meaningful only if the view controller is taking up the full screen.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view controller should be presented modally by a popover.
The controller for the active presented view’that is, the view that is temporarily displayed on top of the view managed by the receiver.
The quick actions displayed when a user swipes upward on a 3D Touch preview.
The search display controller associated with the view controller.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view controller’s contents should autorotate.
Indicates the highest vertical extent for your onscreen content, for use with Auto Layout constraints.
Notifies the view controller when its view finishes laying out its subviews.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view should underlap the status bar.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
